name: Squilla maritima
Relationship: Compare: DIGIT.; STROPHANT.; APOCYN. CAN.; BRY.; KALI-CARB. Squilla follows DIGITALIS, if this fails to relieve water-logged cases.

Heart: A cardiac stimulant affecting the peripheral vessels and coronary arteries
Eyes: Sensation as if swimming in cold water
Feel irritable; child bores into them with fists
Respiratory: CHILD RUBS FACE WITH FIST DURING COUGH
Cough provoked by taking a deep breath or cold drinks, from exertion, change from warm to cold air
Frequent calls to urinate at night, passing large quantities
VIOLENT, furious, exhausting cough, with much mucus; profuse, salty, slimy expectoration, and with INVOLUNTARY SPURTING OF URINE AND SNEEZING
DYSPNOEA AND STITCHES IN CHEST, and painful contraction of abdominal muscles
Fluent coryza; margins of nostrils feel sore
Sneezing; throat irritated; short, dry cough; must take a deep breath
Urine: INVOLUNTARY spurting of urine when coughing
Skin: Small, red spots over body, with prickling pain
Extremities: Icy cold hands and feet, with warmth of the rest of the body

details: Acts especially on mucous membranes of the respiratory and digestive tracts, and also upon the kidneys. Valuable in chronic bronchitis of old people with mucous rales, dyspnoea, and scanty urine.A slow acting remedy. Corresponds to ailments requiring several days to reach their maximum. Persistent, dull, rheumatic pains permeate the body. A spleen medicine; stitches under left free ribs. Important heart and kidney medicine. BRONCHOPNEUMONIA.
